data.title: User markdown-it or remarkable to replace marked for markdown render

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Should we use [markdown-it](https://github.com/markdown-it/markdown-it) or [remarkable](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/remarkable) to replace marked for markdown preview?

It seems that marked had beed dead for a long time(see [issue](https://github.com/chjj/marked/issues/724)), and many issues and PRs are not responsed.

From above issue, it seems that markdown-it is better than remarkable. see [here](https://github.com/markdown-it/markdown-it#authors)

Such as, marked now not support table in lists, but markdown-it and remarkable does.

data.title: Build task is running forever in background and not displaying any message in the output window.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open a folder which contains .ts ile.
2. Press F1 and insert command "Configure Task Runner".
3. Verify task.json is generated with some default setting.
4. Update default setting for command args for your .ts file like below:
"args": ["testme.ts"],
5. Press ctrl+shift+B to build.

Actual:
1. testme.js is created and task runner icon is showing forever.
2. No message display in output window.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14036973/e9637716-f1fb-11e5-8499-73adb6e4dbf3.png)

Expected:
1. Looks like task is running in background in infinite loop
2. When build is successful it should display message in the output window so that user can understand task status.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14037016/7b5c35d6-f1fc-11e5-8028-987607a206ce.png)
3. When User try to rebuild again by pressing Ctrl+Shift+B then it is sowing warning message like:
"**There is an active running task right now. Terminate it first before executing another task."**

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:

- OS Version: Arch Linux (4.4.5-1) amd64

I have a task to compile my go app and run it, however to restart the app I have to terminate it first then start it again.

Maybe add a "restart build task" option where it'd kill the current running task and start it again, or is that currently possible?

data.title: Incorrect rendering of ascii escape sequences in REPL

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version:Windows 10 version 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write to the REPL window using a string with an ascii escape sequence indicating both color and boldness as parameters e.g. '\u001b[35;1mmagentabold'
2. Either bold or text color work separately but they do not work together.  Nor are the escape sequences properly removed from the output.

A repo showing the problem can be seen here https://github.com/eightvans/asciiescape
A comment in replViewer.ts references this link http://ascii-table.com/ansi-escape-sequences.php showing how the sequence should be parsed.

data.title: Problems rendering adjacent bold and italics

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Render this text in VS Code:
   Methods are named **Abc**_ObjectAction_, where _Object_ describes the object and _Action_ indicates what the function does. For example, [**AbcDeviceCreate**](http://msdn.microsoft.com) creates a device object.
2. Compare to GitHub rendering.  Having bold adjacent to italics causes Code to stay in italics mode after the closing italics marker.

data.title: Icon to show running task in the status bar is not displaying all the time.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. launch app and open any folder which has a project with gruntfile.js.
2. Press F1 and enter ">task run" and select option for run task like below and choose "serve" task from the list.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14033888/4d3afd70-f1db-11e5-9977-da8b08836f97.png)
3. Verify status bar and make sure icon should be displayed to indicate running task
4. If icon is showing up then terminate the current task and fire other task and verify status bar.

Actual:
1. Icon is not displaying all the time (in my case build task).
2. Once user terminate the current task (in my case serve task) and fire the same task again then icon is not displaying in the status bar.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14033975/0d4710d6-f1dc-11e5-842d-cc682b1c2887.png)

data.title: Not getting any option on UI to terminate running task ("Run task" for Grunt.)
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version:windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. launch app and open any folder which has a project with gruntfile.js.
2. Press F1 and enter >task run and select option for run task like below and choose "serve" task from the list.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14033531/488c19e2-f1d8-11e5-99f6-bcada8bc3ef3.png)
1. Verify VScode output window and it should launch a browser for with proper URL.
2. Verify in the status bar you a stick rotating icon should be displayed till task is running.
3. Try to terminate running task.

Actual: 
1. When user clicks on icon from status bar which is indicating running task, we are expecting some kind of notification or pop-up to take further action on running task.
2. I didn't find any option to terminate current running task from UI, except when I fire other command or type "terminate running task" from command palette.

Expected: There should be some UI control to terminate current running task. or when user click on icon showing running task  status should display pop-up like below:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14033569/a618ceb6-f1d8-11e5-9262-0f3aaa6cc541.png)

data.title: Resize the sidebar and editor pannels by double-clicking on their border
data.body:
Both Sublime Text and Atom have the ability to resize the sidebar to its “optimal width” (_ie_: the minimum width that is large enough to display every element inside) by double clicking on its border:

![resize-sidebar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1730702/14068197/3871b3b8-f47c-11e5-8786-2f08751370a2.gif)

I’m opening the feature request to have something similar on VSCode.

![screen shot 2016-03-24 at 3 09 56 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10361685/14029858/849f4e28-f1d2-11e5-900f-3f6dd7849903.png)

Below is my config in launch.son

```
    {
        "name": "Run mocha",
        "type": "node",
        "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha  --opts ${workspaceRoot}/__tests__/setup/mocha.opts",
        "stopOnEntry": false,
        "args": ["__tests__/specs/tests/google_search_test.js"],
        "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
        "runtimeExecutable": null,
        "env": { "NODE_ENV": "production"}

```

When try to debug the test, getting this error.. looks like underscore before and after my folder gets lost (**tests**)

data.title: git commit fails when vscode is already open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set vscode as your editor in git config.
2. Open vscode.
3. Using Git Bash, run git commit.
4. An error in Git Bash returns which states "Aborting commit due to empty commit message."
5. A new vscode Window opens with COMMIT_EDITMSG to enter the commit message.

When using Visual Studio Code, I use Git Bash to do all my git work including commits, though commits can be done using vscode itself but I think it is just a single line commit. The issue is that I can't commit from Git Bash (unless I use the -m option) while vscode is open.

data.title: [FYI] Using git on msys2
data.body:
As I filed issue ago, vscode can't work with msys2's git. Because git provided on msys2 return `/c/` prefixed-path for rev-parse command.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/387

If you really want to use msys2's git, try following.
1. Write git-wrap.bat for git.exe
   
   ``` batch
   @echo off
   setlocal
   
   rem If you don't add path for msys2 into %PATH%, enable following line.
   rem set PATH=c:\msys64\usr\bin;%PATH%
   
   if "%1" equ "rev-parse" goto rev_parse
   git %*
   goto :eof
   :rev_parse
   for /f %%1 in ('git %*') do cygpath -w %%1
   ```
   
   Put this git-wrap.bat into somewhere.
2. Set `git.path` for git-wrap.bat
   open `File` -> `Preferences` -> `User Settings`, And add `git.path` pointed `git-wrap.bat` on your configuration file like below.
   
   ```
     "git.path": "c:/users/mattn/bin/git-wrap.bat",
   ```
3. Restart vscode

Have fun!

data.title: Feature request: Add support for line and column numbers in the Go To File feature
data.body:
A lot of times I use the Go to File feature I'm copy pasting the file from another source (for example errors from TSLint or TypeScript) which in my case are of the format:
src\test\folder\other_folder\my_file.ts(9,9)

If I could paste that directly into the Go to File field, and I'd take me first to the file and then to the line (and maybe slightly highlight the line or something so I focus on that line directly) it'd be very useful.

Given that the way to specify line and column is probably dependent on the source, you'd probably need to either have some smart logic, or provide some setting in the user settings where I can define a regexp to match my case like:
[ { pattern: "((\d+),(\d+))$", lineAppearsFirst: true }]

data.title: [c++] Syntax highlighting for C++ breaks after a specific printf statement
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  0.10.11
- OS Version:
  Kubuntu 16.04 LTS Developer branch

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I have a .cc file with the following contents.
   # if B4G_DEBUG_CHECK
   
   fprintf(stderr,"num_candidate_ret=%d:", num_candidate);
   for(int i=0;i<num_candidate;++i)
       fprintf(stderr,"%d,",user_candidate[i]);
   fprintf(stderr,";");
   # endif
2. Observe that syntax highlighting for any statements following the  fprintf(stderr,";"); assumes that the following lines are contained within the double quote and they show up in red. Apparently the ; inside the double quote is misinterpreted as the end of a statement. The "); on the same line is already shown in all red color, and all following lines are too - unless they contain another double quote. In this case the string inside the double quote is shown as if it was a code statement.
   ![snapshot1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/416723/14019003/e6c4c13e-f1d0-11e5-9160-c6527eaec4b6.png)

Partial screenshot attached.

data.title: slim TS/JS workers
data.body:
this is for the **standalone editor**. before salsa we used to share the code with VS Code. Now many things are obsolete
- [x] remove rewriting
- [x] remove special linting
- [x] remove notion of project
- [x] remove features like quick fix, logical selection, etc
- [x] use simplified worker model
- [x] update TypeScript to 1.8.9

data.title: Add platform detect functions in keybindings.json for `when` field

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.2

I use vscode both in OS X and Linux. And I want to backup my configs via github. So I can soft link **settings.json** and **keybindings.json** to corrent directory.

Suppose I want to map `cmd+y`(OSX ) or `ctrl+y`(Linux) to `redo` in **keybindings.json**

Now I have to create two files. `keybindings.osx.json` and `keybindings.linux.json`. The only difference is in **keybindings.osx.json** I map `cmd+y` to `redo`, and in **keybindings.linux.json** I map `ctrl+y` to `redo`.

Can I mix these configs in just one file `keybindings.json`, and use platform detect function to decide which map rule work?

Just like below or something else?

``` json
[
  {
    "key": "cmd+y",
    "command": "redo",
    "when": "os.isDarwin"
  },
   {
    "key": "ctrl+y",
    "command": "redo",
    "when": "os.isLinux"
  }
]
```
